timeline.bodyText: Care to give an example?  (What does a Version-id look like)
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: What's a good example to give when it's just a UUID that the API generates for you? Should I just add "-uuid?"
replies.author: dzlier-gcp

replies.bodyText: You can just say, provided by the API.  (It didn't appear typed, perhaps it should be)
replies.author: lesv

timeline.bodyText: Should this be public since it's guiding the input?
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: This is modeled after all the other samples, so for consistency I'd prefer not to have just this one be different. It's more just an in-sample reference for how the path is structured.
replies.author: dzlier-gcp

replies.bodyText: Yes - but this string isn't a useful thing to pass, ideally, you'd have a builder in the client lib for the string, the next level would be to publish that string in the client lib, and short of that do so in the sample so that it can be used in other places.
replies.author: lesv

timeline.bodyText: Should the v1beta1 be defined near the top in all caps so users could easily change it?
timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: Are users meant to copy this code directly? I always advocated for making this code as copy-pastable as possible, but it seemed like the sample format didn't go in that direction.
replies.author: dzlier-gcp

timeline.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: Why do we need to set this?
replies.author: lesv

replies.bodyText: I believe I set this at one point because the calls were hanging for long periods of time, and I needed the tests to fail and not hang indefinitely if the call wasn't being returned.
replies.author: dzlier-gcp

timeline.bodyText: This is fine for tests, but in samples, I'd prefer we used json objects using Guava's GSON, Jackson, or org.json JAVA-Json
timeline.author: lesv

timeline.message: Use Java 11, and GSON in FhirResourceTests.
Use Java 11, and GSON in FhirResourceTests.
Use Java 11, and GSON in FhirResourceTests.
Use Java 11, and GSON in FhirResourceTests.
